## Device

![ASSET_TAG](#ASSET1)Powered wheelchairs.  
  
All chairs in the Harrier range.  
  
Manufactured by Invacare.

## Problem

The drive wheel may detach from the wheelchair, as a result of being incorrectly refitted due to inadequate service/maintenance instructions in the technical manual. 

The manufacturer published a [ASSET_TAG](#ASSET0) (182Kb) to notify technicians of the revised removal / refitting procedure. The manufacturer has not received sufficient confirmation that this FSN had been received and acted upon.

## Action

Ensure that technicians responsible for maintenance of Harrier wheelchairs:  
  
  * have a copy of the amended procedure – this is attached to the Field Safety Notice, and can also be downloaded from the [Invacare website](http://doclibrary.invacare.co.uk/Office/Europe/Marketing/MktDocUK.nsf/VALLMDocument/4581E45C16E651FC80257A60004F9961/%24File/Harrier%20drive%20wheel.pdf) (external link)  
  * are aware of the revised guidance regarding removal and refitting of the drive wheel  
  * inform Invacare that the FSN has been received and that the revised procedure has been reviewed and understood.  
  
### Action by

All those involved in the maintenance of these wheelchairs. In particular: wheelchair service managers, rehabilitation engineers and maintenance staff.

## Distribution

This MDA has been sent to:  
  
  * NHS trusts in England (chief executives)  
  * HSC trusts in Northern Ireland (chief executives)  
  * NHS boards in Scotland (equipment coordinators)  
  * Local authorities in Scotland (equipment coordinators)  
  * NHS boards and trusts in Wales (chief executives)  
  * Primary care trusts in England (chief executives)  
  * Social services in England (directors)  
  * Social services in Scotland (directors)  
  
### Onward distribution

Please bring this notice to the attention of relevant employees in your establishment. Below is a suggested list of recipients.

Trusts  
CAS and SABS (NI) liaison officers for onward distribution to all relevant staff including:  
  
  * Equipment stores  
  * Rehabilitation engineers  
  * Wheelchair service managers  
  
Primary care trusts  
CAS liaison officers for onward distribution to all relevant staff including:  
  
  * Equipment libraries and stores  
  * Maintenance staff  
  
Social services  
Liaison officers for onward distribution to all relevant staff including:  
  
  * Disability equipment stores  
  * Equipment stores  
  * Loan store managers  
  * Loaned equipment store managers  
  * Wheelchair and seating service managers
